description: From Latin exacure, from ex (“out (intensive)”) + acuere (“to make sharp”). See acuate, acute.

verbs.description: exacuate (third-person singular simple present exacuates, present participle exacuating, simple past and past participle exacuated)

examples: He hath done you wrong in a moſt high degree: And ſenſe of ſuch an injury receiv'd Should so exacuate, and whet your choler.
